page.title: 10Climate
page.content: Our D Block is in the county of Mid Glamorgan in South East Wales.Our location is known as approximatly 320 metres above sea leval,but due to higher ground around rising to reach 900 metres,this has a marked effect on our climate.Winter began slighter earlier than the coastal area of South Wales,and lasts slightly longer.The winters can be quite wet and snow is common every year,amounts vary from year to year.Due to the slighter longer winter season the growing season is affected.Rainfall an average for a year is in the region of 50" or 125cm.The natural tree cover is mainly deciduous trees and some coniferous forests owned by the Forestry Commission, growth being marked by the upland nature of the terrain.
